title: How can Visa itself be part of things like Blockfi and FTX?
text:
https://usa.visa.com/visa-everywhere/blog/bdp/2021/07/06/crypto-linked-cards-see-1625612645562.html

In last decade many crypto companies were using middle banks to offer physical card services. So many services/cards cancelled because many banks were against it and VISA/MC were not clear about supporting it directly. But last year or so Visa itself directly partnered with it.

After all years these were the one they decided with all DD, expertise and financial knowledge? I mean Visa is not some VC or bank, they are way beyond them I think.

Sounds so fishy tbh.

There is a direct link to blockfi.com CC, imagine using it because of trusting Visa just to lose a lot?

Ask HN: With ChatGPT, is now a good time to leave education?
text:
I've been seriously mulling over this the last couple of weeks. I teach computer science and, while it has always been a balance to teach students to effectively use tools (like Stack Overflow, Copilot, et. al.), I've always been able to come up with obscure and specific enough take-home problems that students can use these tools yet also be forced to solve a significant portion of the problem on their own.

ChatGPT changes everything. Feeding it any number of my take-home assignments yields 90%+ of the answer. In fact, we've already caught a number of students using this to cheat even in the few weeks before Winter Break.

It seems that now might be the perfect time to leave the education world. I'm not sure how to solve this problem (and it is an immediate issue) and I don't really want to spend my days policing students (or giving up altogether and letting them use these tools unfettered).

Ask HN: Have some funding, need idea
text:
Hi! I'm a repeat entrepreneur who recently raised $150k from friends & family for my next company. I spent a couple of months looking into building trading tools for defi, but have concluded now is not the best time to do that and want to pivot. I have a CS background, and have spent most of my career in finance and healthcare tech, but am looking at my next opportunity with a wide open mind.

So I turn to the brilliance of the HN collective for ideas. Any and all suggestions welcome!

Why Is Personal Knowledge Management (PKM) Useful
HN Suggestion: show comment number for each user
text:
I like hearing lots of opinions about a topic, but do not much like it when a zealot is replying to lots of posts. It subconsciously gives their opinion more weight because I am seeing it many times, though I may not realize that while I'm reading through the discussion.

It would give me more context about a poster to show their comment sequence number for that thread. So for their first post in a topic, something like:

  aardv 16 minutes ago #1 | root | parent | next [–]
This is a fundamental problem of social media, and one of the ways IMO to have better discussions is to limit people's participation. For example, if a person could only post a handful of times to a topic, they would likely make sure that their comment is important enough to use up one of their limited posts rather than engaging in long back-and-forths with one person. I'm not suggesting any posting limits for HN, but having a count for each user in each topic would at least alert me to maybe adjust my credence filter.

Ask HN: Is there a great DAG framework for Python?
text: For synth patches, we love our Direct-Acyclic Graph apps like Max/MSP, PureData, Axoloti, SpinCAD Designer, etc.  But most of these are native apps or Java.  How can I write "one DAG editor to rule them all" that can target multiple DSP targets, microcontrollers, raw C code, other APIs with a simple-ish plug-in archtecture.  Most of them time, these apps are written by passionate synthesists and hence the limited portability, but how would a hardcore CS approach this?
